intro: Scutellaria sarmentosa, commonly known as creeping skullcap, is a perennial herb native to North America. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has a sprawling, low-growing habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular blue or violet flowers. Its medicinal properties have been historically used by indigenous peoples for various ailments. The genus Scutellaria is known for its distinctive calyx that resembles a scutellum, a feature shared by this species.
